Node.definition: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message

literally = the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= causative action by which humans or deities cause information that is stored in someone else's mind to be reprocessed by speaking about it
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= pertaining to having a thin cutting edge; ► in order to make it useful and effective as a tool; ≈ often associated with aggression and danger

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= causative action by which someone keep someone else from (physical or non physical) harm
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
= causative action by which humans carefully examine an object in order to determine whether it is clean and do whatever is needed to make sure that it is clean
= long, narrow container ► for storing one's arrows
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of honor and respect more than others
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: empty; hence: = state in which an event does not serve a useful purpose and is bound to fail

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= something that has no value and hence does not profit anyone
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= causative action by which deities, humans, or animals bring an activity to full completion
= marker used to affirm the truth of the following statement, which is in contrast with what was assumed to be the truth earlier on
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
literally: to turn (someone to someone else); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans to associate with deities, often to look for help and support

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose

Node.gloss: to be honorable|to be worthy of honor|to be renowned
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are regarded as worthy of honor and respect

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to be a trivial matter|to be of no consequence|to come easy
Node.definition: = state in which an event is regarded as relatively unimportant, not requiring much effort or thought

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

Node.gloss: to take back|to bring back|to return|to put back|to restore (something)
Node.definition: literally: to turn; hence: = causative action by which animals, humans, deities cause (other) animals, humans, or objects to move back to a location where they have been before

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

Node.gloss: to despise|to disdain|to scorn|to consider (something) beneath (oneself)
Node.definition: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to be faithful|to be reliable|to be trustworthy|to be true
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to give in possession|to will (one's) property
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities give land and other possessions to (other) humans as their permanent possession, with equal focus on the recipients and on the object that is being divided

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= to be held by someone else, either in a prison or in another situation in which one does not have the freedom to act and go at will; ≈ usually regarded as hardship

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= action by which a deity or human being causes himself to become visible to others
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
= open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats
= to be in a state of wanting or needing food, but having little to no access to food
= state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire
= state in which the atmosphere is exceedingly hot, possibly caused by a desert wind

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= a place where water wells up from an underground source

= causative action by which humans or deities help (other) humans or animals to journey from one place to the other by accompanying them and providing them with resources and protection whenever necessary
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand
= causative process by which humans, deities or forces cause an object to be of a great and more than average height
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
literally: the sea; = a cardinal direction pointing towards the west, ◄ which, in Israel, is the direction towards the Mediterranean Sea
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= location; possibly Syene, town in Egypt (מִצְרַיִם)
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= the inner part of the human hand (יָד) but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

Node.gloss: to carve|to portray|to draw|to mark out|to write
Node.definition: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= action by which humans or deities act without delay
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction

Node.gloss: to destroy|to lay waste|to cause destruction
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans and deities cause total destruction to lands, constructions, or towns, including the people living there, either directly or through the hands of others, to the extent that sedentary life is no more possible there

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to come together|to gather|to assemble|to rally|to (re)unite
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments
= action by which humans attach ornaments to their body or clothing
= woman who is about to be married or has just been married; ≈ often associated with joy
= state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which something is in extreme disrepair ◄ caused by either neglect or destruction
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= state in which an object is relatively small in size, ≈ with the connotation of being too small to be able to do what it is intended for
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which an object is relatively small in size, ≈ with the connotation of being too small to be able to do what it is intended for, and with trouble
= action whherby humans move to a location further away from a point of reference
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans have lost one or more of their offspring
= state in which humans are unable to conceive a child
= action by which a group of people leave their country because they are forced to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to make grow|to bring up|to rear|to educate|to tend
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans take care of young plants or young humans while they undergo the natural development of increasing in size and changing physically on their way to being fully grown
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to lift up (one's) hands; hence: = action by which humans raise their arms to receive out, beckon, bless, or pray

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= causative process by which humans take an object from a relatively low position and raise it up

= a distinctive object in the form of a flag or board attached to a stick, or a metal device or image fitted on the end of a pole; ► normally used to identify a particular group, or as a rallying point for soldiers in war; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an example, or a person or deity that one can rely on, or something that shows the way
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= front part ◄ of garment, ► that, since it is usually wide and contains large folds, can be used to help carry objects
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= the joint between each arm and the main part of the human body; ► often used for carrying heavy weights

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man or woman responsible for raising and educating one or more children on behalf of the parents
= a woman of rank

= the entire front side of a person's head, with special focus on the forehead, which is the part that touches the ground when a person does obeisance, and the part that is covered with sweat during hard work

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

literally: to lick the dust; hence: = process by which humans are deeply humiliated by being forced to lie prostrate on the ground before those in authority, and, in some cases, having to lick the dust from their feet
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= a person or group that has been forcibly carried off to prison, into slavery, or resettlement
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= a person or group that has been forcibly carried off to prison, into slavery, or resettlement
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= person who has a conflict with someone else
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

Node.gloss: to make (someone) eat|to give (someone) to eat
Node.definition: = action by which someone gives other people food for consumption, sometimes with the added connotation that these people are actually forced to consume it; with or without explicit object

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation and probably still relatively fresh; ► used as beverage; ≈ associated with agriculture, joy, and well being, but also with drunkenness; also used in metaphors for aggression and sex

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land
= process by which humans become intoxicated ◄ as a result of having too much alcohol
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
probably a variant spelling of אַבִּיר (אַבִּיר) = name of God, stressing his great power and his exclusivity as the God of Jacob and his descendants

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
